skill.name: python-performance-optimization
skill.description: Profile and optimize Python code using cProfile, memory profilers, and performance best practices. Use when debugging slow Python code, optimizing bottlenecks, or improving application performance.
skill.summary: Profile and optimize Python code using cProfile, memory profilers, and performance best practices. U...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing Python optimization guidance. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting code examples in markdown documentation. The skill provides instructional content only; no code is executed, no network calls are made, and no files are accessed. Users receive guidance on profiling tools and optimization patterns.

content.value_statement: Slow Python code hides bottlenecks that waste resources and time. This skill guides you through profiling and optimization steps with concrete tools and patterns.
actual_capabilities: Explain cProfile and pstats usage with example setup
Show line-level profiling patterns with line_profiler
Demonstrate memory profiling with memory_profiler and tracemalloc
Compare optimization patterns for loops, strings, and dict lookups
Describe multiprocessing and async I/O approaches
Outline database batching and query planning basics
limitations: Does not execute profilers or run benchmarks
Requires installing optional tools such as line_profiler or py-spy
Examples are generic and need adaptation to your codebase
No performance guarantees without real measurements

use_cases.title: Reduce API latency
use_cases.description: Profile slow endpoints and apply caching or data structure changes for faster responses.

use_cases.title: Speed up batch jobs
use_cases.description: Optimize loops, memory usage, and I/O patterns in data pipelines.

use_cases.title: Performance review plan
use_cases.description: Create a profiling plan and prioritize fixes for the largest bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Profile a slow function
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal cProfile example for a slow function and explain how to read the top cumulative time results.

prompt_templates.title: Line profiler guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to use line_profiler on one function and how to interpret per line timings.

prompt_templates.title: Memory hotspot check
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a memory_profiler or tracemalloc approach to find peak allocations in a script.

prompt_templates.title: Optimization strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest optimization options for a CPU bound pipeline, including algorithm changes, caching, and multiprocessing.

output_examples.input: Help me profile a slow data processing function and suggest improvements.
output: Run cProfile and sort by cumulative time to find the hottest functions
Replace list accumulation with generators where possible to reduce memory
Consider multiprocessing for CPU bound steps after profiling confirms bottlenecks

output_examples.input: My Python API responds slowly under load. How do I find the bottleneck?
output: Use cProfile to identify which functions consume the most time
Check for N+1 query patterns in database access
Consider adding lru_cache to repeated computations
Profile with py-spy on production if safe

output_examples.input: Show me how to optimize memory usage in a long-running script.
output: Use tracemalloc to track allocations and find leaks
Replace lists with generators for streaming data
Use __slots__ in classes to reduce per-instance memory

best_practices: Profile before optimizing to confirm bottlenecks exist
Benchmark each change to validate that improvements occurred
Focus optimization effort on hot paths that run most often
anti_patterns: Optimizing without first profiling to identify real bottlenecks
Changing multiple variables between benchmarks making it hard to measure impact
Over-optimizing cold code paths that rarely execute

faq.question: Is this compatible with my Python version?
faq.answer: It targets modern Python tools; older versions may need minor syntax or tool adjustments.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only and does not execute profilers or modify code.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, it references common tools like cProfile, line_profiler, and py-spy that fit most workflows.

faq.question: Does it access or send my data?
faq.answer: No, it is documentation only and does not read or transmit any data.

faq.question: What if profiling results are unclear?
faq.answer: Share the top slow functions and call stacks to get targeted next steps.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic advice?
faq.answer: It focuses on Python specific profilers and concrete optimization patterns with real examples.
